content:
I don't have personal preferences or opinions as a human, but i can mention some popular newsletters that curate news from different sources:

1. the skimm: this daily newsletter provides a quick and easy-to-read summary of the day's top news stories, complete with links to additional sources for more information. 2. the daily beast cheat sheet: the cheat sheet newsletter is a brief rundown of the day's top headlines in politics, world news, and entertainment, with a bit of humor thrown in. 3. axios am: this morning newsletter provides a concise summary of the day's top news stories, as well as additional deep-dives into specific topics like technology, healthcare, and finance. 4. the week: this weekly newsletter summarizes the top stories of the week in politics, top headlines, and opinion pieces, with links to more in-depth articles for those who want to learn more. 5. next draft: this daily newsletter is written by a journalist and provides a humorous take on the news of the day, with links to a range of sources for more information. again, it's important to read from a range of sources to get a well-rounded perspective on any given topic, but newsletters like these can be a helpful way to stay informed and save time.
